#Text=Canada 's Trinity — Spadina ( Ward 20 ) city council candidates speak
#Text=Friday , November 3 , 2006
#Text=On November 13 , Torontoians will be heading to the polls to vote for their ward 's councillor and for mayor .
#Text=Among Toronto 's ridings is Trinity — Spadina ( Ward 20 ) .
#Text=One candidate responded to Wikinews ' requests for an interview .
#Text=This ward 's candidates include Desmond Cole , Helen Kennedy , Douglas Lowry , Chris Ouellette , Carmin Priolo , Devendra Sharma , Joseph Tuan , and Adam Vaughan .
#Text=For more information on the election , read Toronto municipal election , 2006 .
#Text=Doug Lowry
#Text=48-year-old
#Text=Doug Lowry is a settlement officer , Money Market Operations , at TD Securities .
#Text=Q : Describe the three most important issues in your campaign .
#Text=A : The 3 more important issues in main campaign are
#Text=1. we have to be competitive against Markham and Mississauga so the concentration of work remains in the downtown area , by supporting our business community .
#Text=Work is changing fast and jobs that used to have to be in the downtown area , do not necessarily have to be , I do not believe Council gets it .
#Text=2. we need a Problem Properties Committee which is proactive to fix properties and improve neighbourhoods .
#Text=3. we need to encourage people to continue to reinvest in their buildings , one method is to have solar panels on homes
#Text=Q : What one election issue do you feel is most relevant to your ward in this election ?
#Text=A : The Problem Properties Committee ( which can easily exist in every Ward ) to tackle problems before they reach crisis and drag on for months .
#Text=The committee is made up of the Councillor , the police , and city regulation staff , the Councilor is to provide the political will .
#Text=In this fashion , neighbours can do what neighbours do , enjoy their property .
#Text=Q : Why have you chosen to involve yourself in the political process ?

#Text=A : In Ward 20 , there is no incumbent , I have served on a number of committees in the neighbourhood which allows me to have been exposed to many issues , and I live here and I believe I would do a good job .
#Text=Q : Why do you want to represent this particular ward on council ?
#Text=A : Most of my activities are involved with the Ward , I live in the middle of it , I walk to work through the Ward .
#Text=My interest in the Ballet - their office is in the Ward , ( on the waterfront ) , although the Four Seasons is just outside .
#Text=I am the Treasurer of provincial and federal political associations which ecompass the Ward .
#Text=My doctor(s) are on one side of the Ward , a community centre which I am involved with is on the other side and I try to shop throughout the Ward .
#Text=This all means I regularly go through the Ward , I am familar with its history and tend to know it the best .
#Text=Q : How are you currently involved in the community ?

#Text=A : I have active membership in the CLPC - 14 Division , Scadding Court Community Centre , the Waterfront Residents Association , a resident association just outside the Ward , representative of the my building at TCHC , plus I like gardening .
#Text=These memberships besides going to community meetings , ( and holding executive positions ) means looking at many types of issues and having links to other groups .
#Text=These groups means looking at the many different viewpoints on a regular basis , although I have biases , being exposed is good .
#Text=Q : What does Toronto mean to you ?
#Text=A : Toronto to me is both myth and reality , although it pretends it is an open city , it is much more closed than one thinks it should be .
#Text=Toronto is place to learn and to work and that is why people come here .
#Text=When I first came to Toronto to study at Ryerson , having the Blue Jays was beneficial to me liking the city .
#Text=Upon living in the City for a couple years , it was time to explore it and that lead to a lifelong appreciation of ballet .
#Text=Toronto is also opportunity because it is so big , but to see it , you must bring it to a size you are comfortable with .
#Text=Q : Which council decision ( since the 2003 election ) do you feel the city/your ward should be most proud of , and which was least desirable ?

#Text=A : Best Council Decision was something that did not make large headlines , but it could have a large impact , Council decided to takeover a derelict property in Parkdale and convert it to housing .
#Text=Worst Council Decision was a plan by the Nuns in Scarborough to convert some of their land to housing and it was turned down .
#Text=Q : If you were elected as a " rookie " councillor , What would you bring to the table beyond the incumbent ?
#Text=A : Because I believe Toronto is more of a closed society , where innovation happens all to infrequently , I would hope to change this by voting for innovative things .
#Text=I would hope that I would be able to back those that try to do something better by allowing a degree of failure , to be quickly fixed .
#Text=I would also , continually thank people for trying to make this city better , most in small ways , but as a group what a difference ! !
